title: Vector algebra - finding the change in velocity

content.question: An object is moving with an initial velocity <math alttext="vector v sub 1 equals, open parenthesis, 3.00 times i hat, plus 4.00 times j hat, close parenthesis, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3.00</mn><mtext> </mtext><mover accent="true"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>i</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>4.00</mn><mtext> </mtext><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo><mo> </mo></mrow><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>. After a certain time interval, its velocity is <math alttext="vector v sub 2 equals, open parenthesis, negative 8.00 times i hat, plus 15.0 times j hat, close parenthesis, meters per second." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>8.00</mn><mtext> </mtext><mover accent="true"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>i</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>15.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>. What is the magnitude of the change in velocity of the object over this time interval?

choices.label: <math alttext="11.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>11.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="12.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="15.6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>15.6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="19.6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>19.6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="15.6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>15.6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
